conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph to determine collision time.
Car A starts braking from 25 m/s and stops at 30 seconds; Car B starts braking from 15 m/s and stops at 25 seconds.
The area under the v-t graph represents the distance traveled by each car.
Car A's distance is calculated as 375 meters using the area of the triangle under its v-t graph.
Car B's distance is calculated as 187.5 meters using the area of the triangle under its v-t graph.
At 20 seconds, Car A has traveled 200 meters.
At 20 seconds, Car B has traveled 100 meters.
The relative distance between Car A and Car B at 20 seconds is 100 meters.
At 20 seconds, Car A is catching up to Car B.
The collision occurs after 20 seconds of braking.
